நிற்பதுவே, நடப்பதுவே, பறப்பதுவே, நீங்களெல்லாம்

கால மென்றே ஒரு நினைவும் காட்சியென்றே பலநினைவும்

Time as memory, vision as multitude of recollections
are our forms and appearances fake - our roles just guises?
If trees of a grove spring from a seed, is the grove itself unreal?
Can this connection be made through words?
BhashaVerse:
Is the fruit of time a reminder, a vision, a dream, a dream, a dream, a dream, a dream, a dream, a dream, a dream, a dream, a dream, a dream, a dream, a dream?

(Translation with breaks in between lines)

If all that is seen disappears, does all that is hidden disappear?

(Translation without any breaks)
ChatGPT 5.2:
Is time itself but a single memory, and sights but many memories?
Are forms and patterns all lies?—are even virtues there lies?
If in a grove all the trees arise from a single seed,
Is the grove not a lie?—who would join this to their words?

Source:
காண்பவெல்லாம் மறையுமென்றால் மறைந்ததெல்லாம் காண்ப மன்றோ? 
வீண்படு பொய்யிலே- நித்தம் விதிதொடர்ந் திடுமோ?

காண்பது சக்தியாம்- இந்தக் காட்சி நித்தியமாம்.
Reference:
If everything we see fades, can everything that fades be seen again?
Amidst these fruitless lies - will fate bind us forever?
Everything we see might not be the truth
But we did see whatever we saw - and that’s the eternal truth.
BhashaVerse: If all that is seen is hidden, will all that is hidden be seen? If all that is seen is hidden? If all that is seen is hidden? If all that is seen is hidden, will all that is hidden be seen? If all that is seen is hidden?
ChatGPT 5.2:
If all that is seen must vanish, then must not all that has vanished be seen again?  
In futile falsehood—does fate keep following us forever?  
We have found certainty only in what is seen; apart from what is seen, there is no certainty.  
Seeing is power—this vision is eternal.

Reference:
O Bliss
that bestows Joy
on both 
the unlettered and the lettered

O Eye
that confers vision
on both
the sightless and the sighted

O Fortune
that grants boons
to both
the mighty and the weak

O Wisdom
that confers knowledge
on both
the obedient and the dissident

O Centre
that stands
nonaligned between
the good and the notorious

O Wellness
that accords virtue
to both
the mortals and the immortals

O Lord 
dancing
in the open 
for all to see

Bless me

My King,
adorning yourself
with the song
I sing.
BhashaVerse: Kallark and Learner's Toy is Toy The eye that glances at the one who sees and sees It is a boon to Vallark and Mattar The noon of reverence and respect Between Nallark and Pollark The welfare of the Naras and the Suras Shiva is the one who makes everyone public Narase Yanpukal will wear music
ChatGPT 5.2:
Joy that grants delight to the unlearned and the learned alike,  
Eye that gives sight to those who see not and those who see,  
Boon that bestows grace on the able and the unable alike,  
Moon that gives radiance to those who know not and those who value,  
The just mean that stands impartial between the good and the bad,  
Goodness that grants well-being to mortals and to gods,  
Siva who dances in common for all,  
My King—grant me refuge, and the grace adorned with harmony.
